bug.short_desc: Vertical scrollbar singleStep property not synced with rowHeight

long_desc.thetext:
Symptom: The vertical scrollbar in a qx.ui.table.Table widget has a fixed value of 20 in it's singleStep property. If the table's rowHeight differs from this value, clicking on the up/down arrow buttons of the scroll bar scrolls an uneven amount of rows, e.g. if the rowHeight is 60, you need to click three times on the button to scroll one line.
Expected behaviour: On each click on the up/down button of the scroll bar, one line should be scrolled up or down, respectively.
Fix: Listen to the changeRowHeight event of the table and sync the singleStep property accordingly: this.getPaneScroller(0).getChildControl("scrollbar-y").setSingleStep(e.getData());
How to reproduce: 1. Go to the table example in the playground: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/devel/playground/#Table-ria 2. Add a rowHeight property to the table initialization with a value of 40 or 60 3. Execute the example 4. Click on the down button in the scroll bar multiple times to see the wrong behaviour
